answers.answer: Ignore AST and ALT while on treament, not an indicator of eventual success or failure.  Only thing that matters is viral load.
I too was undectable at 2 1/2 weeks, I am type 2b. I have only minor inflamation in my liver. I did shot 13 tonight my alt and ast actually rose a bit my dr said not to worry it all looks good.
my alt/ast did not go into the normal range until after treatment ended.  do not worry about that - and I have fatty liver.

whats going on with the viral load tests - are people getting them every day - cant anyone wait a month as per protocol - no wonder insurance is messed up - yes fatty liver affects liver enzymes - more importantly is can affect treatment outcome by weakening the immune response - and fatty liver can cause diabetes which further compromises the immune system - no test should be ignored especially when on treatment - some however can be taken with the grain of salt - a single high or low reading often indicates normal fluctuations - what is of concern are consistent repeated highs or lows

question: So my parnter was undetected at week 2 - but his ALT and AST levels have not dropped that much.ALT is 72 and AST is 65.  Apparently their explanation at the liver clinic is that he also has a fatty liver - common with genotype 3 which would account for the lack of drop in ALT?  Does this mean his chances of SVR are even less now?  They are both lower than when he started.  Only one injection left......but he does have stafe 3 early 4 cirrohsis
title: Anyone ever heard of this
